name: wood pellet production | wood pellet, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9783/documentation

This dataset represent the inputs and outputs of materials and energy for wood pellets production. Pellets are produced in a wood pellets factory which uses wood residue from sawmills and woodchips as raw materials. The raw materials are firstly pre-treated and dryed, then comminuted and mixed. In the end they are pellettized, cooled and bagged. Pellets that are packed in 15 kg-bags amount to the 20% of the production. The remaining 80% are sold unpacked. The pellets produced match the caracteristics of the German standard of quality DIN-plus (certification).;There is no waste modelled of the packaging film and maize starch, since these inputs will be part of the final product.

From the receipt of the raw material at the pellet factory 

This activity ends with the final product (wood pellets) ready to be delivered at the production factory.It doesnt include the transport of the pellets to the final customers.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production in a modern wood pellets factory in Switzerland (years 2011- 2012)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: extrapolated from Swiss data, pellet properties taken from German standard of quality
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: visit at the pellet production factory, answers to a technical questionnaire, personal communications with the wood pellets production company

flow.name: wood pellet, measured as dry mass

exchanges.description:
calculated value.

According to company questionnaires, 0.13 kg of wood chips, wet are used per kg of wood pellet produced. 

The share of softwood (169kg/m3) amounts to 95%, the share of hardwood (239kg/m3) to 5%.

exchanges.description:
The value provided by the pellet production company reports heat used for drying the raw material (0.06912 MJ/kg) plus for heating of the buildings (0.0432 MJ/kg). However, compared to scientific literature (Hafenberg et al., 2009, and Nanou et al., 2016) this amount seems too low. Therefore, a heat input of 3.5MJ per kg of pellets was adobted from the mentioned literature sources.
Hagenberg, L., SÃ¤rnholm, E., Gode, J., Ekvall, T., Rydberg, T., 2009, LCA calculations on Swedish wood pellet production chains - according to the Reneable Energy Directive. Retrieved online <https://www.ivl.se/download/18.343dc99d14e8bb0f58b7597/1445517411880/B1873.pdf>, 15.5.2018
Nanou, P., Carbo, M. C., Kiel J.H.A., 2016,Detailed mapping of the mass and energy balance of a continuous biomass torrefaction plant. Retrieved online from <https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0961953416300332#sec3.3>, 15.5.2016
